description.narrative: The PDO is to facilitate a sustainable supply of gas through targeted investments in gas infrastructure and enhanced gas sector governance .

description.narrative: Total Commitment in Fourth Quarter of 2019

condition.narrative: No later than eight (8) months after the Effective Date: MoMP shall recruit a management firm, with terms of reference,qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Association to, among other things, build the capacity of the staff of theProject Management Team and MoMP and provide support for the management of the Project (including on fiduciary aspects). (Schedule2, Section I.A.1(d) of the FA)

No later than one (1) month after the Effective Date (and prior to implementing any Project activities within AGE or AOGRA -as thecase may be), MoMP shall enter into a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with AGE and a MoU with AOGRA, or a MoU with AGE and AOGRA,to among other things, (A) record the scope and modalities of cooperation between AGE or AOGRA, as the case may be, and MoMP and(B) further define the implementation arrangements, including the procurement of assets on behalf of a beneficiary and theirownership, the responsibility to supervise delivery of services by consultants, and the recording of the Recipient’s investment inAGE and AOGRA under the Project. (Schedule 2, Section I.A.1(e) of the FA)

No later than one (1) month after the Effective Date or such other date which the Association has confirmed in writing isacceptable to the Association: the Recipient shall contract the services of a supervision engineer selected on the basis of termsof reference, qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Association to, support MoMP and AGE for activities related to theconstruction of the Sheberghan - Mazar-e-Sharif Pipeline and operation and maintenance of the pipeline and key facilities.(Schedule 2, Section I.A.3 of the FA)

No later than one (1) month after the Effective Date: The Recipient shall ensure that the Project Management Team shall include thefollowing staff: (A) one (1) Project coordinator; (B) one (1) dedicated financial management specialist; (C) one (1) dedicatedprocurement specialist; (D) one (1) environmental specialist; and (E) one (1) social specialist. (Schedule 2, Section I.A.1(b)(ii)of the FA)
No later than one (1) month after the Effective Date: the Recipient (through the MoMP) shall adopt one or more manuals for theimplementation of the Project. (Schedule 2, Section I.E.1 of the FA)

No later than three (3) months after the Effective Date: MoMP shall recruit an expert in national internal audit, on the basis ofterms of reference, qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Association to, among other things, assist in building thecapacity of MoMP’s internal audit department. (Schedule 2, Section I.A.1(c) of the FA)

The Recipient shall ensure that the Project is carried out in accordance with the Environmental and Social Standards and the ESCP,in a manner acceptable to the Association, including with respect to the preparation, consultation, disclosure and implementationofthe ESIA, RP and ESMP related to Sheberghan - Mazar-e-Sharif Pipeline and new desulfurization amine plant, to environmental andsocial reporting and notifications and to the maintenance and publicization of the Project’s grievance redress mechanism. (Schedule2, Section I.C of the FA)

title.narrative: Percent of project related grievances addressed within one month
Increased capacity to deliver commercial quality natural gas through to off-takers in Sheberghan and Mazar
Share of women professionals in technical and managerial fields at MoMP and OAGRA
Production of a jointly-developed (MoMP and AOGRA) contractual and regulatory package for gas sector development.

baseline.value: Hydrocarbons Law (2018) and Exploration & Production Sharing Contract Template.

target.value: Final Draft of Prioritized Contractual and Regulatory Framework ready for submission to Cabinet.

actual.value: Hydrocarbons Law (2018) and Exploration & Production Sharing Contract Template were approved prior to broad, representing thebaseline. Administrative regulations were more recently approved.

title.narrative: Improved institutional, regulatory and contractual framework for gas sector management and oversight

baseline.value: Hydrocarbons Law (2018) and Exploration & Production Sharing Contract Template.

target.value: Primary regulatory and contractual framework for upstream and mid-stream gas sector development submitted to Cabinet.

actual.value: Hydrocarbons Law (2018) and Exploration & Production Sharing Contract Template. Administrative regulations have been approved.

title.narrative: Adoption of an updated field development plan for Yatimtaq gas field
Commissioning of the new amine plant
Development and dissemination of code of conduct to prevent Gender Based Violence in the extractive sector for investors
Launch of an international tender Totimaidan gas blocks
Project management firm recruited and maintained by MoMP
Afghanistan’s EITI validation report shows improved results on greater number of parameters than the previous validation report
Environmental and Social Unit of the MoMP fully staffed, operational and maintained.

baseline.value: Unit is currently staffed with consultants only

target.value: Unit is staffed with fully civil servants and operational - Staffing of Unit is maintained, an E&S management system has beendeveloped and is systematically used by staff to monitor E&S risks/impacts in the sector

actual.value: Unit is currently staffed with consultants only, and includes a team lead, 2 env specialists, one social development specialist,and a GRM specialists. Procurement international specialists (firm) to support the E&S unit has been delayed.

title.narrative: Implementation of key recommendations from functional management review for AOGRA

target.value: All recommendations from functional review implemented

title.narrative: Commissioning for new Sheberghan-Mazar Gas Pipeline
